page.title: 18RELIGION IN WEST NOTTINGHAM
page.content: There are eighteen{Churches}in our particular area. Of these, eight are { {Non-conformist,}eight are{Church of {England}of which one is attached to a cemetary, of the other two, one is also attached to a cemetary, and one to a Hospital. There are no Roman Catholic{Churches}and no non-Christian places of worship in the area. The age of the buildings range from mid nineteenth century to early twentieth century, however one church St. Leodagarius dates back to the twelfth century and contains traces of a thirteenth century church and fourteenth century work. The present building, however, dates f4om l858-l861 when the church was restored and re-built. Today churches are often closed during the day as a result of the ever present threat of vandalism and theft.
